metadata.dc:author: Waissbluth, A
Galán, G
Arteaga, J
Bustamante, C
Gayán, P
metadata.dc:description: The experience with microsurgical technique in 131 infertile women is presented. The 65.7% had distal tubal occlusion and 16.7% had proximal occlusion. In 48.9% of the women the peritoneal factor was present. In 61.8% distal surgery was done: 16.8% fimbrioplasties and 45% neosalphingostomies. The pregnancy rate was 47.4%. The incidence of ectopic pregnancy was 20%. The 85.5% of the pregnancies was performed in the two first years of follow up. With these results the good prognosis factors, with statistical significance, were: a. Age under 30 years. b. Infertility under 10 years of evolution. c. Normal male factor. The results are commented.
metadata.dc:title: Técnica microquirúrgica en infertilidad por factor tuboperitoneal. Resultados.
[A microsurgical technic in infertility due to a tuboperitoneal factor. The results].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista chilena de obstetricia y ginecologia
